org.modelio.api.modelio.diagram.tools.standard

Class GenericAttachedBoxTool

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.modelio.api.modelio.diagram.tools.DefaultDiagramTool
      • org.modelio.api.modelio.diagram.tools.DefaultAttachedBoxTool
        • org.modelio.api.modelio.diagram.tools.standard.GenericAttachedBoxTool
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IAttachedBoxTool, IDiagramTool

    public class GenericAttachedBoxTool
extends DefaultAttachedBoxTool
    Generic tool to create node attached to another node (Notes).

    This class provides hook methods to allow sub classes to configure created elements.

    #postConfigure(IDiagramHandle, IDiagramGraphic, LinkRouterKind, ILinkRoute, Point, MObject, MObject, List) is called by #actionPerformed(IDiagramHandle, IDiagramGraphic, LinkRouterKind, ILinkRoute, Point) .

    postInDiagramConfigure(IDiagramHandle, Rectangle, ModelElement, MObject, List) is called by actionPerformedInDiagram(IDiagramHandle, Rectangle)

    • Method Detail

      • acceptElement

        public boolean acceptElement(IDiagramHandle diagramHandle,
                             IDiagramGraphic targetNode)
        Description copied from class: DefaultAttachedBoxTool
        This method accept or refuse the interaction in the diagram.

        This method is called until the interaction is validated by the user.
        If the interaction is allowed the method return new InteractionStatus(true, "");
        If the interaction is not allowed the method return new InteractionStatus(false, "Tooltip message"); . In this case the mouse pointer is changed to a "forbiden" icon and the tooltip message is displayed in a tooltip near the mouse pointer

        Specified by:
        acceptElement in interface IAttachedBoxTool
        Specified by:
        acceptElement in class DefaultAttachedBoxTool
        Parameters:
        diagramHandle - the representation of the diagram in which the interaction occurs.
        targetNode - the graphic that is below the mouse pointer.
        Returns:
        an InteractionStatus that represents the result of the acceptElement method.

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(IDiagramHandle diagramHandle,
                            IDiagramGraphic graphic,
                            IDiagramLink.LinkRouterKind routerType,
                            ILinkRoute path,
                            Point point)
        Description copied from class: DefaultAttachedBoxTool
        This method is called when the user click on an existing diagram element.

        The method is in charge of creating the model element in the model and of unmasking the element in the diagram.

        The originNode argument contains the diagram node container corresponding to the origin graphic box.

        The rect argument is the rectangle that result from the user interaction with the diagram. This rect should be used to manage the unmasking of the model element in the diagram.

        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface IAttachedBoxTool
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in class DefaultAttachedBoxTool
        Parameters:
        diagramHandle - the representation of the diagram where the command has been triggered.
        graphic - the graphic parent where the user has clicked.
        routerType - the router type that is currently defined to compute the path of the link.
        path - the link path deduced from the user interactions.
        point - the point of the second user click.
        See Also:
        IDiagramHandle.unmask(MObject, int, int)

      • actionPerformedInDiagram

        public void actionPerformedInDiagram(IDiagramHandle diagramHandle,
                                     Rectangle rect)
        Description copied from class: DefaultAttachedBoxTool
        This method is called when the user click in the diagram background.

        The method is in charge of creating the model element in the model and of unmasking the element in the diagram.

        The rect argument is the rectangle that result from the user interaction with the diagram background. This rect should be used to manage the unmasking of the model element in the diagram.

        Specified by:
        actionPerformedInDiagram in interface IAttachedBoxTool
        Specified by:
        actionPerformedInDiagram in class DefaultAttachedBoxTool
        Parameters:
        diagramHandle - the representation of the diagram where the command has been triggered.
        rect - the rectangle of the object to create.
        See Also:
        IDiagramHandle.unmask(MObject,int, int)

      • postConfigure

        protected void postConfigure(IDiagramHandle diagramHandle,
                             IDiagramGraphic parentGraphic,
                             IDiagramLink.LinkRouterKind routerType,
                             ILinkRoute path,
                             Point point,
                             MObject parentElement,
                             MObject newElement,
                             java.util.List<IDiagramGraphic> newGraphics)
        Hook called by #actionPerformed(IDiagramHandle, IDiagramGraphic, LinkRouterKind, ILinkRoute, Point) once the element is created, configured, unmasked and before the transaction is committed.

        Does nothing by default. Sub classes may redefine this method to make additional modifications.

        Parameters:
        diagramHandle - the diagram handle
        parentGraphic - the graphic under which the element was unmasked
        routerType - the router type that is currently defined to compute the path of the link.
        path - the link path deduced from the user interactions.
        point - the new graphic position.
        parentElement - the model element owning the new element.
        newElement - the created model element.
        newGraphics - the graphics relating the new element that were unmasked.

      • postInDiagramConfigure

        protected void postInDiagramConfigure(IDiagramHandle diagramHandle,
                                      Rectangle rect,
                                      ModelElement parentElement,
                                      MObject newElement,
                                      java.util.List<IDiagramGraphic> newGraphics)
        Hook called by actionPerformedInDiagram(IDiagramHandle, Rectangle) once the element is created, configured, unmasked and before the transaction is committed.

        Does nothing by default. Sub classes may redefine this method to make additional modifications.

        Parameters:
        diagramHandle - the diagram handle
        rect - the new graphic bounds.
        parentElement - the model element owning the new element.
        newElement - the created model element.
        newGraphics - the graphics relating the new element that were unmasked.
